definitions.definition: be aware of through observation, inquiry, or information.
examples: most people know that CFCs can damage the ozone layer
I would write to him if I knew his address
synonyms: be apprised of; formalbe cognizant of "I think Mary knows his address"

definitions.definition: be absolutely certain or sure about something.
examples: I just knew it was something I wanted to do

definitions.definition: have developed a relationship with (someone) through meeting and spending time with them; be familiar or friendly with.
synonyms: be familiar with; Morebe friends with
be intimate with "I know only a few people here"

definitions.definition: have a good command of (a subject or language).
examples: be familiar with, be conversant with, be acquainted with, have knowledge of, be versed in, have mastered, have a grasp of, understand, comprehend; Morehave learned, have memorized, be up to speed on "you should know the rules beforehand"Morehave learned, have memorized, be up to speed on you should know the rules beforehand
Isabel couldn't hear the words clearly, but she knew the voice
a little restaurant she knew near Times Square

definitions.definition: have personal experience of (an emotion or situation).
examples: a man who had known better times

definitions.definition: regard or perceive as having a specified characteristic.
examples: he is also known as an amateur painter

definitions.definition: give (someone or something) a particular name or title.
examples: the doctor was universally known as “Hubert.”

definitions.definition: be able to distinguish one person or thing from (another).
examples: you are convinced you know your own baby from any other in the world
synonyms: identify "my brothers don't know a saucepan from a frying pan"
